question: Which Qualifying Life Events require proof of prior coverage to be eligible for a Special Enrollment Period?
text:
Which Qualifying Life Events require proof of prior coverage to be eligible for a Special Enrollment Period?
          
        
In addition to providing documentation demonstrating eligibility to enroll in coverage through a qualifying life event, customers seeking to enroll in Virginia's Insurance Marketplace coverage using one of the events below must also show they have had minimum essential coverage for at least one day in the past 60 days.
Qualifying Life Events that also require customers to show they had at least one day of coverage in the past 60 days:
Qualifying Life Events that also require customers to show they had at least one day of coverage in the past 60 days:

Income Reduction, with Gain in Eligibility for Financial Help


Marriage (at least one spouse)



New Virginia Resident or move within VA



Survivor of Domestic Abuse or Spousal Abandonment



What documents can I submit to demonstrate I had prior coverage?
Documents must show that you (or your dependent) had coverage for at least one day in the past 60
. These documents must include your name and should be on official letterhead or stationery. Documents you can submit include:
Documents must show that you (or your dependent) had coverage for at least one day in the past 60


A document from your insurance company
, like a letter, notice, or a statement showing you are, or were, enrolled in health coverage.



A document from an employer
, like a letter, notice, or statement stating the coverage you had through your employer, or through a family members employer, including through COBRA.



A document from a government healthcare program
, like a letter or notice from Medical Assistance, the Family Access to Medical Insurance Security Plan (FAMIS), TRICARE, Veterans Affairs (VA), or Peace Corps.



A health insurance letter
that contains confirmation of health coverage and expiration dates for coverage received outside of the Marketplace, or through another states Marketplace.



A letter, notice, or statement
detailing student coverage



A pay stub
showing a deduction for health coverage from your employer in the past 60 days


A document from your insurance company
A document from an employer
A document from a government healthcare program
A health insurance letter
A letter, notice, or statement
A pay stub

What if you do not have one of the above documents?
If you have had coverage in the previous 60 days, but need further assistance to submit documentation, please contact Virginia's Insurance Marketplace Customer Service at 1-888-687-1501.
